node.title: Kyrgios, Kokkinakis eye off doubles final after roaring into Australian Open semis
node.alt: Two Australian male tennis players chat between points during a doubles match.
node.description: With the crowdÂ once again whipped into a frenzy, Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis edge closer to an appearance in the men's doubles decider with a three-set win in the last eight.
node.content: ["The inspired\u00a0run of Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis in the\u00a0Australian Open men's doubles has continued with a tense three-set win over sixth seeds\u00a0Tim P\u00fctz and Michael Venus.", "[Key points]", "The Kia Arena crowd was again abuzz with excitement as the unseeded Australian pair roared into the semifinals on the back of the 7-5, 3-6, 6-3 triumph, which they celebrated with an enthusiastic chest bump.", "The combined power of their booming serves proved crucial in the\u00a0victory, with Kyrgios and Kokkinakis sending down a staggering 25\u00a0aces.", "While the raucous crowd were thrilled with the victory, they were also touched by a heartwarming moment involving Kyrgios.", "Early in the first set, an errant Kyrgios smash flew into the crowd, with the ball hitting a young\u00a0boy in the stands.", "It was unintentional from Kyrgios, who immediately showed remorse.", "As chair umpire Eva Asderaki-Moore checked on the boy's condition, Kyrgios ran to his bag and took out one of his racquets.", "He gave the racquet to the boy, with the crowd showing its appreciation with a round of applause.", "More to come."]
